title: 111_hr4098
content: The "Secure Federal File Sharing Act" is the short title of the Act. It outlines the requirements that need to be met. The "Secure Federal File Sharing Act" mandates the Director of the Office of Management and Budget to issue guidance within 90 days on prohibiting the use of open-network peer-to-peer file sharing software on all Federal computers and networks, unless approved under specific procedures. It also addresses the use of such software on personal computers for telework purposes. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget must develop a procedure for approving specific open-network peer-to-peer file sharing software programs for Government employees and contractors. The software must be necessary for agency operations or instrumental in supporting the agency's mission. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget must direct agencies to establish or update personal use policies consistent with guidance issued, require contractors to comply with the guidance, and update their information technology within 180 days of the Act's enactment. Direct agencies to update their IT security and ethics training policies to ensure all employees, including contractors, understand the guidance and consequences of prohibited conduct. Ensure proper security controls are in place to prevent unauthorized file sharing software on Federal computers and networks. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget must submit an annual report to specific committees regarding the implementation of the Act, including justifications for approved peer-to-peer file sharing software and a list of agencies using such programs. In this Act, definitions are provided for terms such as "agency", "open-network", and "peer-to-peer file sharing software". An agency is defined as an Executive agency as per section 105 of title 5, United States Code. An open-network refers to a network with unrestricted access or minimal security measures. Peer-to-peer file sharing software is described as a program that allows files on a computer to be shared and searched. The curr_chunk describes the ability of a program to search and copy files to other computers without requiring action from the owner or authorized user. The curr_chunk specifies the conditions under which a program can search and copy files to other computers without needing user intervention. The curr_chunk defines the term "contractor" as a prime contractor or subcontractor according to the Federal Acquisition Regulation. The budgetary effects of this Act will be determined by the latest statement for compliance with the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of 2010. The statement must be submitted by the Chairman of the House Budget Committee before the vote on passage.
